movie.title: J. Edgar
movie.plot: As the face of law enforcement in the United States for almost 50 years, J. Edgar Hoover was feared and admired, reviled and revered. But behind closed doors, he held secrets that would have destroyed his image, his career, and his life.
movie.awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 5 wins & 16 nominations.

events.title: Franz Jägerstätter declares his conscientious objection, and is arrested

movie.title: A Hidden Life
movie.plot: Austrian farmer Franz Jägerstätter faces the threat of execution for refusing to fight for the Nazis during World War II.

events.title: police arrest Raymond Fernandez and Martha Beck

movie.title: Lonely Hearts
movie.plot: Based on a true story. . . . In the late 1940s, Martha Beck and Raymond Fernandez were America’s notorious “Lonely Hearts Killers.” Their lethal scam was simple; they would swindle and then viciously murder lovelorn war widows who would answer their personal ads in which Ray would describe himself as a sexy Latin lover.

events.title: Bobby Sands begins a hunger strike

movie.title: Hunger
movie.plot: The story of Bobby Sands, the IRA member who led the 1981 hunger strike in which Republican prisoners tried to win political status. It dramatises events in the Maze prison in the six weeks prior to Sands’ death.

events.title: A Brief History of Time is published

movie.title: The Theory of Everything
movie.plot: The Theory of Everything is the extraordinary story of one of the world’s greatest living minds, the renowned astrophysicist Stephen Hawking, who falls deeply in love with fellow Cambridge student Jane Wilde.
